info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.usage.plan
info.description: Usage plan related RPCs. Used for billing and onboarding.

get.description: Endpoint to get current usage plan

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

display_name.description:
Human readable name of addon

Example: ` "Transfer from RE to CE"`
display_name.title: Display name

name.description:
Name of the addon feature

Example: ` "re-2-ce-v1"`
name.title: Name

planListUsagePlansRsp.description: Response with the usage plans info
planListUsagePlansRsp.title: Usage Plans Response

locale.description:
Locale in the ISO dashed  format

Example: ` "en-us"`
locale.title: Locale

plans.description: Collection of currently publicly available plans.
plans.title: Plans

planPeriodUnitType.description:
Temporal period type

 - PERIOD_UNKNOWN: unknown, undefined period of time
 - PERIOD_DAY: Day
 - PERIOD_WEEK: Week
 - PERIOD_MONTH: Month
 - PERIOD_YEAR: Year
planPeriodUnitType.title: Period type

planPlanInternal.description: Structure that holds all data needed to choose usage plan
planPlanInternal.title: PlanInternal

allowed_addon_services.description: List of addon services that can be subscribed part of current plan.

billing_disabled.description: If true then there's no automatic billing.
billing_disabled.title: Billing disabled

current.description: True if plan is active. Note that customers are only allowed to current plans.
current.title: Current

description.description:
Description of the plan as mark-down text.

Example: ` "###Free plan, includes x y z *Free item 1 *Free item 2 ##Self-support only"`
description.title: Description
description.x-ves-example: ###Free plan, includes x y z *Free item 1 *Free item 2 ##Self-support only

flat_price.description:
Flat fee of the plan in cents

Example: ` "100"`
flat_price.title: Flat price

included_addon_services.description: List of addon services that are available part of current plan.

name.description:
Name of the plan, the name is not guaranteed to be human readable.

Example: ` "free-p25-v2"`
name.title: Name

subtitle.description:
Optional second line of the title of the plan, human readable.

Example: ` "Our free plan"`
subtitle.title: Sub-Title

title.description:
Title of the plan, human readable.

Example: ` "Free"`
title.title: Title

trial_period.description:
Trial period associated with this plan. Different pricing conditions are in place during the trial period - flat fee my not apply, or similar

Example: ` "3"`
trial_period.title: Trial period

planPlanState.description:
State of the

 - STATE_UNSPECIFIED: zero value
 - STATE_READY: the plan is in default state
 - STATE_TRANSITION_PENDING: the plan is in the state of plan transitioning. If the plan has current flag equals to true and in
TRANSITION_PENDING then tenant moves to another plan which is in state TRANSITION_PENDING.
At the same moment in time no more than 2 plans should have TRANSITION_PENDING state
planPlanState.title: PlanTransitionState

planPlanTransitionMethod.description:
Transitioning method which UI should show to the customer to properly execute the transition between

 - TRANSITION_METHOD_UNSPECIFIED: Zero value
 - TRANSITION_METHOD_SUPPORT: The transition should be done via a support request, the current behaviour for any transition
 - TRANSITION_METHOD_WIZARD: The transition should be done via a custom Wizard. Fields which should be
provided will be guided by PlanTransitionRequiredField
 - TRANSITION_METHOD_RECREATE: The transition should be done via logging the user out, deleting the current tenant and creating a new one
planPlanTransitionMethod.title: PlanTransitionMethod

planPlanTransitionRequiredField.description:
fields which UI should provide to the backend to properly execute the transition between plans

 - TRANSITION_REQUIRED_FIELD_UNSPECIFIED: Zero value
 - TRANSITION_REQUIRED_FIELD_PAYMENT_TOKEN: Stripe token after user enters CC info and we submit it to stripe
 - TRANSITION_REQUIRED_FIELD_DOMAIN: Domain for team/organization plans which will be used for keycloak realm
 - TRANSITION_REQUIRED_FIELD_CONTACTS: Contacts is billing contacts
planPlanTransitionRequiredField.title: PlanTransitionRequiredField

planUsagePlanTransitionFlow.description: Details for transition flow. Is used as part of UsagePlanInternal
planUsagePlanTransitionFlow.title: UsagePlanTransitionFlow

required_fields.description: Mandatory information to migrate onto this plan
required_fields.title: Required fields

requires_manual_approval.description: If true then any migration onto this plan must be approved by the billing department.
requires_manual_approval.title: Manual approval

quotaFloatLimitType.description:
x-displayName: "Limit (float)"
FloatLimitType defines a float quota value that should not be exceeded. Useful for items that have
quotas in fractions.
quotaFloatLimitType.title: FloatLimitType

quotaLimitType.description:
x-displayName: "Limit"
LimitType defines a quota value for a specific object kind that should not be exceeded
quotaLimitType.title: LimitType

maximum.description:
x-displayName: "Maximum"
x-example: "100"
The maximum value for the object kind
maximum.title: maximum

quotaRateLimitType.description:
x-displayName: "Rate Limit"
RateLimitType defines a rate quota value for a specific object kind that should not be exceeded in terms access per time unit
quotaRateLimitType.title: RateLimitType

burst.description:
x-displayName: "Burst"
x-example: "100"
The burst which is to be allowed per quanta
burst.title: burst

rate.description:
x-displayName: "Rate"
x-example: "100"
The sustained rate which is to be allowed per quanta
rate.title: rate

unit.description:
x-displayName: "Unit"
x-example: "per-second"
The unit for the quanta
unit.title: unit

rate_limiterLeakyBucketRateLimiter.description:
x-displayName: "Leaky Bucket Rate Limiter"
Leaky-Bucket is the default rate limiter algorithm for F5
rate_limiterLeakyBucketRateLimiter.title: LeakyBucketRateLimiter

rate_limiterRateLimitBlockAction.description:
x-displayName: "Rate Limit Block Action"
Action where a user is blocked from making further requests after exceeding rate limit threshold.
rate_limiterRateLimitBlockAction.title: RateLimitBlockAction

rate_limiterRateLimitPeriodUnit.description:
x-displayName: "Rate Limit Period Unit"
Unit for the period per which the rate limit is applied.

 - SECOND: Second

x-displayName: "Seconds"
Rate limit period unit is seconds
 - MINUTE: Minute

x-displayName: "Minutes"
Rate limit period unit is minutes
 - HOUR: Hour

x-displayName: "Hours"
Rate limit period unit is hours
 - DAY: Day

x-displayName: "Days"
Rate limit period unit is days
rate_limiterRateLimitPeriodUnit.title: RateLimitPeriodUnit

rate_limiterRateLimitValue.description:
x-displayName: "Rate Limit Value"
A tuple consisting of a rate limit period unit and the total number of allowed requests for that period.
rate_limiterRateLimitValue.title: RateLimitValue

burst_multiplier.description:
x-displayName: "Burst Multiplier"
x-example: "1"
The maximum burst of requests to accommodate, expressed as a multiple of the rate.
burst_multiplier.title: burst_multiplier

period_multiplier.description:
x-displayName: "Periods"
x-example: "1"
This setting, combined with Per Period units, provides a duration
period_multiplier.title: period_multiplier

total_number.description:
x-displayName: "Number Of Requests"
x-example: "1"
x-required
The total number of allowed requests per rate-limiting period.
total_number.title: total_number

rate_limiterTokenBucketRateLimiter.description:
x-displayName: "Token Bucket Rate Limiter"
Token-Bucket is a rate limiter algorithm that is stricter with enforcing limits
rate_limiterTokenBucketRateLimiter.title: TokenBucketRateLimiter

schemaEmpty.description:
x-displayName: "Empty"
This can be used for messages where no values are needed
schemaEmpty.title: Empty

schemaPlanType.description: PlanType is the type of billing plan for the customer
schemaPlanType.title: PlanType

schemaTenantType.description:
TenantType is the type of the customer

UNKNOWN indicates the field not being set
FREEMIUM are customer that don't have their domain
ENTERPRiISE customer have their domain
schemaTenantType.title: TenantType

schemaquotaGlobalSpecType.description: GlobalSpecType defines the shape of the object in database as present in Global Controller
schemaquotaGlobalSpecType.title: GlobalSpecType

api_limits.description:
API Limits defines ratelimit parameters for an API at the stdlib service
 The key of the api_limits map is rpc FQN e.g. "ves.io.schema.advertise_policy.API.Create"

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 512
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.pattern: ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9-._]*[a-zA-Z0-9]$
api_limits.title: api_limits

apigw_limits.description:
API Gateway Limits defines rate limit value parameters for an API at a service level (prism, sentinel, etc)
 The key of the apigw_limits map is rpc FQN e.g. "ves.io.schema.advertise_policy.API.Create"

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 512
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.pattern: ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9-._]*[a-zA-Z0-9]$
apigw_limits.title: apigw_limits

object_limits.description:
Object Limits define maximum number of instances that can be present per object kind for the tenant
 The key of the object_limits map is object kind e.g. "virtual_host"

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 512
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.pattern: ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9-._]*[a-zA-Z0-9]$
object_limits.title: object_limits

resource_limits.description:
Resource Limits define maximum value of resources in the appropriate units that can be present. The key of
 the resource limits is the resource name

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.max_len: 512
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.min_len: 1
  ves.io.schema.rules.map.keys.string.pattern: ^[a-zA-Z][a-zA-Z0-9-._]*[a-zA-Z0-9]$
resource_limits.title: resource_limits
